titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Franklin Lindsay papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Elena Danielson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-01-19T16:30-0800

change.item: 2018 January 19: Added links to materials from the 2010 release of records and 2018 release of records sub-series that are available on digitalcollections.hoover.org. -Sally DeBauche <change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20151102" era="ce">November 2, 2015</date><item>Revised to add declassified materials returned to file.</item></change> <change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20120731" era="ce">July 31, 2012</date><item>Revised to update encoding.</item></change> <change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20110121" era="ce">January 21, 2011</date><item>Updated extent statement and date range to include new increment.</item></change> <change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20091110" era="ce">November 10, 2009</date><item>Updated encoding, added unitid, removed restriction on Yugoslavia typescript, box 9.</item></change> <change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20040323" era="ce">March 23, 2004</date><item>PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Franklin Lindsay papers)//EN" "reg_292.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).</item></change>

did.abstract: Reports, memoranda, correspondence, and photocopies of Office of Strategic Services and British government documents relating to resistance movements in Yugoslavia during World War II, Allied relations with them, Office of Strategic Services operations in Yugoslavia and Austria, post-World War II economic recontruction in western Europe, the Organization for European Economic Cooperation, and American foreign aid to Europe. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Franklin Lindsay papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1946, with increments received in 1982, 1992, 1993 and 2010.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: With Columbia Division, U.S. Steel Corp.
Served in the Army of the United States, to Lieutenant Colonel
With the Office of Strategic Services
Chief, American Military Mission to Yugoslavia
Executive assistant to Bernard Baruch, U.S. Delegation, U.N. Atomic Energy Commission
Consultant, House Select Committee on Foreign Aid (Herter Committee)
Served as an American representative to the Organization for European Economic Co-operation, Paris
With the Public Affairs Program, Ford Foundation
Chairman of the Board, Itek Corp.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Reports, memoranda, correspondence, and photocopies of Office of Strategic Services and British government documents relating to resistance movements in Yugoslavia during World War II, Allied relations with them, Office of Strategic Services operations in Yugoslavia and Austria, post-World War II economic recontruction in western Europe, the Organization for European Economic Cooperation, and American foreign aid to Europe.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed, mimeographed, hectographed, typescript, holographic, and handwritten reports; memoranda; and correspondence relating to the Interim Report on the European Recovery Programme drafted by the Organization for European Economic Co-operation in 1948 and to its annual programs, arranged as listed.

did.unittitle: "Capital Investment and Production Coordination," memorandum from Foster to Richard M. Bissell,
"Comments on Problems Raised by the First Draft of the Mechanism of Foreign Relief and Reconstruction," memorandum from W. Y. Elliott to Allen W. Dulles,
"Draft Executive Committee Resolution Concerning O.E.E.C. Relations with the Press," memorandum,
"Draft Note from the Secretary General to the Council on Relations between O.E.E.C. and the United States Special Representative in Europe," memorandum.

"Recommended Measures to Reduce Demand on U.S. During Third Quarter by Promoting Trade in European Exportable Surpluses," memorandum from Paul R. Porter to W. Averell Harriman,
"Schema d'assistence mutuelle," memorandum from F. le Norcy to W. Tomlinson,
"Western Hemisphere Payments," memorandum from Finletter to Lindsay,
Program for the fourth quarter, memoranda,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed, mimeographed, hectographed, typescript, holographic, and handwritten reports; memoranda; and correspondence relating to the work of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, the Herter Committee, partisan activity in Yugoslavia, and general economic reconstruction in Europe, arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: American Mission for Aid to Greece (AMAG)
"Additional Information requested by Subcommittee D of the Select Committee on Foreign Aid," report,
"Agricultural Institutions in Greece," by the Foreign Economic Administration, report,
"AMAG Comments on Greek Marshall Aid Plan," report,
"Brief Summary of Activities of the Royal Hellenic Navy and U.S. Navy Group's Aid Program," memorandum,
"Briefing Conference for Jenkins Subcommittee at Embassy," report,
"Comments made by Colonel Lehner before Congressional Group," memorandum,
"Greek Armed Forces." by Pipinelis, memorandum, December 16; "Greek Situation," by Lindsay, memorandum, October 13,
did.physdesc: Typescript (carbon copy) and cover letter; typescript (carbon copy).

"Legal Relations between the Mission and the Greek Government," memorandum,
"Northern Provinces of Greece," by Vassili Dendramis, memorandum,
"Notes on Reconstruction for Briefing Sessions with Congressional Committees,"
"Opening Statement by Chief of Mission for Congressional Delegation," draft of speech,
"Preliminary Exchange of Notes between U.S. and Greek Governments on Greek Aid Program," correspondence,

"United States Post-War Aid to Greece," by Lindsay,

"The Place of the United States in European Industrial Development," by Lindsay, memorandum for Herter Committee,

Italy, correspondence and reports concrning post-war economic situation
"Answers to Questions of the Select Committee on Foreign Aid," report of the American Embassy, The Hague, and the Netherlands Ministry of Economic Affairs,

Memoranda relating to the Military Staff Committee,

President's Task Force on Government Organization,
Richard M. Nixon presidential transition memoranda
Preparing for the post-election transition, August,
Eisenhower's United States Presidential Campaign schedules,
Beacons in the Night research materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates to British and American operations in Yugoslavia in 1944-1945, including photocopies and notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Available as PDF files. Arranged chronologically by date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes memoranda, messages, meeting minutes, and reports regarding military operations in Yugoslavia (1944-1945) as well as an outline of a War Department study on atomic policy (circa 1946).
